headline: Randy's Slow Cooker Ravioli Lasagna
description: Swap lasagna noodles with ravioli into this slow cooker lasagna recipe for an easy make-ahead dinner on busy weeknights.
name: Randy's Slow Cooker Ravioli Lasagna

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef, garlic, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in the hot skillet until meat is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease. Stir pasta sauce, Italian seasoning, basil, and oregano into ground beef mixture.

Ladle a generous layer of meat sauce into the bottom of a slow cooker; add a layer of ravioli. Ladle another layer of meat sauce over ravioli layer; alternate with remaining ravioli and meat sauce until all ingredients are used.
Cook on Low for 3 to 5 hours. Sprinkle ravioli mixture with mozzarella cheese and continue cooking until cheese is melted, 45 minutes to 1 hour more.

review.reviewBody: Very good tasting and very easy to make.
I made this months ago, and my family loved it.

I think I cooked it too long because it was mushy. I should have checked it after 2.5 hours. Next time, I will use a different brand of pasta sauce because I didn't really care for the one I used. I will also add green peppers and onions. I really liked the ease of it but prep time was much more than 15 minutes. I followed other people's advice and added the mozzerella between each layer.
Tried to use one jare of sauce but ended up needing both. As everything else goes the the recipe is easy and came out great.

I made this with hot Italian sausage and added layers of mozzarella and cottage cheese (didn't have ricotta) with fresh parsley for more of a lasagna taste. I used fresh mushroom ravioli and lowered the cooking time. Turned out great!
Not bad, but not great. Might make again, but will definitely tweak.
This is a delicious meal!! Easier than making your own lasagna!! Made it many times!! Never fails!!!

It turned out fabulous!! The only thing I didn’t do was put shredded Mozzarella cheese between the layers but that’s ok because it definitely doesn’t need it at all, it’s even better without the cheese. I was very generous with the seasoning and I also added ground Italian sausage along with the ground beef. I used 2 jars of roasted garlic pasta sauce and it is fabulous!! 4 and 1/2 hours in my slow cooker was all it took and I will definitely make it again!!
Will make this again and again! Family absolutely Loved it! Just delicious the way the recipe is!
Wasn't the best, didn't really taste like lasagna, just ravioli with meat.
Used ground moose versus beef. And used frozen perogies versus ravioli. Loved it soo much, as did the whole family. Cannot wait to make it again!

Easy to make and quite yummy. I substituted Beyond Beef for the meat and used cheddar cheese because I had a bunch to use up. I used one jar of Bertolli vodka sauce and one Bertolli tomato basil sauce which came out perfect!

I loved this ravioli lasagna! It was very easy to make and it tasted like lasagna! I did what another reviewer did: I put a little extra mozzarella cheese on top of the sauce layers when putting it together to see how it would turn out. Then I put the 2 cups of mozzarella cheese on the top at the end like the recipe states. It was great! Next time, I will add more mozzarella cheese in between the layers. I think it will even taste better! I also used a crockpot liner bag for the first time with this recipe. It worked great, too. After scraping out the leftovers, I just pulled out the bag and threw it away. There was no cleanup of that heavy crockpot other than washing the lid. It was great! I highly recommend this recipe to anyone who loves lasagna but wants to be able to make it easier than the traditional recipe. It was yummy!
Would not make this again. Yes, easy, but no flavor, and I even substituted Italian sausage for hamburger to make it taste better. Very disappointing.
I used ground turkey and 2 different types of sauce. Everyone wanted the recipe. My husband had 2 helpings.
AMAZING

I make this all the time because it’s so easy and delicious. I use fresh ravioli instead of frozen, so I shorten the cook time as I’ve found that the ravioli overcook and become too mushy. I also add some shredded mozzarella after the first layer because more cheese.

I made this today for picky 12 year old twis girls. They loved it! My husband and I also loved it! The only thing I changed from the original recipe was that I added a layer of Mozzarella cheese in each layer, as well as on top. This is such an easy, delicious recipe and I will surely be making it again!!! Thanks for the share!
I really wanted to love this but it was just "okay". Will not make again.
Came out amazing, doubled the sauce as recommended and baked in the oven instead of slow cooker for 1 hour.
Turned out better than expected. I’ll definitely be keeping this recipe! Thank you!
Yum! Made exactly as recipe stated. Was a huge hit with the family! Thank you!
Didn’t use my crockpot. It still came out amazing. I will be making my raviolis this was from now own.

I used 2 packages of mini ravioli for a total of 24 ounces. I have made this a couple of times and my husband couldn’t believe it was made with frozen ravioli-he thought it was from scratch and he liked it!

I made this without meat and it took about 5 minutes to get it going and that was it! I put some spices on jar sauce when layering in the ravioli. I will make it with meat next time but can't explain how easy this is. A full, hearty meal that the kids AND adults loved. Be sure to cook on low...it will get dry and possibly burn on the edges if you cook on high or for too long.
Preparing was very easy, I followed the recipe with a few changes. We used my wife’s homemade sauce. I didn’t use the slow cooker.
This was a hit with my family. My sons asked me to make it again the next night! I followed the recipe exactly, made not changes and it was really yummy!
This was a easy meal to put together and it’s very good! I did make 1 extra jar of sauce and ground beef.
Was so easy. My family of picky eaters loved it. Will be making it again.

Excellent idea to make "lasagna" with ravioli. It was delicious. I did sprinkle mozzarella between layers. Used spinach and cheese ravioli. I did not use the slow cooker, just baked it for 40 minutes covered with foil. After 40 mins, added cheese to top and baked uncovered for 15 additional mins.

Trying this recipe now! Excited for it. I followed the recipe but since my daughter is vegetarian I used Light life smart ground I upped the amounts of all spices too because we like them very flavorful. I plan on making garlic bread. I also used frozen cheese ravioli and it took about 8 of them for each layer. I also used two jars a sauce. And sprinkled Parmesan cheese on top while it cooked in the crock pot. Thank you for a great recipe. Such an easy and quick recipe with easy clean up too. Can’t wait to try it!
Really good stuff. I ended up doubling the amount of all the seasonings, will make again!
I’ll make it again but 2 jars of sauce is too much for me. Per the recipes notes I found about 1.5 jars was perfect and boy was this easy

Ingenious. Loved this in the slow cooker. Referencing many reviews, I added a layer of ricotta w/ 1/2c of chopped fresh spinach. YUM! Never again will I make the more laborious lasagna that my family has been using for 5 decades. This was better in every way. I made 1/2 the recipe and cooked it for just 3 hours. Along w/a salad, it fed 6 people. Perfecto!
family loved it

I added more meat and a little extra sauce. It was a MAJOR hit with my brother (who doesn't really like "lasagna" from a slow cooker). I've made several lasagnas and never had a hit like this. Thank you for sharing your recipe. It is a keeper in my books. I will also pass this recipe on to family and friends.
The Mozzarella cheese I bought was too chewy, next time I will use a different kind of cheese.
This is an easy recipe and everyone loved it!
Excellent recipe just as is! My family loves it.....

This was the Best and easiest pasta recipe that i have done from this site, I was going to grab pasta from a restaurant, but decided to look and on AR since i have gotten so many recipes from here and i am so glad i did (I did use a Cheese Blend - Mozzerella, provolone and parmesean between each layer) ... you will not believe how good this is!!

I made this recipe as it instructs, except for some of the seasonings only because I didn’t have them available. This was delicious and easy to make. I made one for my adult children and grandchildren and they loved it. Then, I made it again for my husband who doesn’t care for pasta dishes. He raved about it to our daughter and told me it was delicious. It’s definitely a keeper
This was such an easy recipe! It was very delicious, but I would use less tomato sauce the next time, extra can be added at the plate if necessary. This will be my new lasagna method.
It came out good but I would call this recipe "ravioli with meat sauce" , not lasagna.
We enjoyed this but would use less ravioli next time as we felt it lacked sauce. But great taste, texture, and filling! We will add this to out monthly rotation of meals.

I loved this recipe essentially as is. I used 2 jars of sauce and am glad I did. I don’t think one is enough. And I just left out the bas because I don’t like basil. Everything else was the same. Super tasty and I will be making this again!

I did add Italian sausage & chopped onions to it the second time I made this and it was incredible. I also used Classico roasted garlic spaghetti sauce. Just make sure you thaw the ravioli first and it’s perfect.
This was very easy and absolutely delicious
After reading the reviews I made this in the oven. I also added about a quarter of a roll of sausage. Then topped it with cheese too and it was a big time success! Love it!!
Amazing, love this recipe along with Randy’s slow cooker lasagna.
The ravioli I used came out extremely soft, almost mushy, but a good recipe when you don't have a lot of time to stand over the stove!
My family loved it. I would say it didn't really seem like lasagna but a really meaty ravioli. It was still really good and the family has requested it for me to make it again.

I made this in the oven, 350 for about 1 hour, covered for the first 45 minutes. Used frozen ravioli. I added ricotta and spinach between the layers. Using 1 jar of sauce, I added a grated zucchini into the sauce just before layering otherwise it turns out too dry. The zucchini gives the extra liquid the ravioli need to cook. We liked it, just don't overcook.
This dish was easy to make and taste very good.
This is a keeper! So easy and everyone always loves it. I throw an extra layer of mozzarella in the middle which makes it so creamy. Thanks for this awesome recipe!

I made this dish for my husband (who happens to love ravioli) and company we were having. I used spinach and cheese ravioli because that’s what I had on hand. Came out very tasty and I would make it again.
Delicious! And so easy too throw together. I added 1 pound of mild Italian sausage to thicken the sauce (this was for the 12-serving recipe). Lots of compliments from my family!

Made this for the first time for our grandson and his family, and everyone loved it. His wife even went back for seconds, which is rare! The only thing I did differently was to use turkey burger instead of hamburger and added 2 cooked and cut up Sweet Italian Turkey sausages. I also did as some other reviewers and added part of the mozzarella to the layers. I used frozen ravioli and cooked on low for 3 hours, then added the remaining mozzarella on top and cooked for another 45 minutes. Will make this again, thanks for the recipe.
This really surprised me. Since I started a little too late to put it in the Slow Cooker, I put it in the oven for about 45 mins and it turned out great. Lady D
My husband loved the amount of sauce I used, I could have just made it with one can, BUT it was so good!

It comes out much better in the oven. I put it together the same way but tightly cover with foil. I don't defrost the ravioli. Bake at 350° for 45-60 minutes , adding the cheese to the top for the last 20-30 minutes. I found it gets too messy in the crock pot but this way keeps it together.
Very easy to make and filling. Family loves it. We alternate between using beef and cheese ravioli when we layer it.
Didn’t care for it. Wasn’t anything like lasagna
This was great!
This was great!
This is delicious!
Family didn't care for it. The ravioli came out a little gummy, so the consistency was unappealing. Perhaps if you shortened the cooking time it would come out better.
used real lasagna instead of the ravioli, it was a little bland
We found it very tasty and certainly easier than “regular” lasagna. I reduced the pasta sauce to 1 1/2 jars, but next time I'll use two jars and increase the meat to 1 1/2 lbs.
Even my teen who doesn't like spaghetti sauce likes This! yum
Loved it! My husband says it need more meat. He says that with anything with meat in it.
I made this and substituted chunks of sweet Italian sausage and Italian meatballs for the ground beef. It gave it a more hearty feel and look.
I made no changes and definitely will make again. Kids and grandkids loved it.
I love this recipe! Followed the directions exactly. So easy and delicious. I will be making this at least montly!
Randy, this is an awesome lasagna - great idea using cheese ravioli!
I substituted ground beef for sweet Italian sausage. This doesn’t require a slow cooker. I baked it in the oven and it was ready in a fraction of the time it would otherwise take.

Made this dish for my Christmas luncheon my employees loved it!!!
I will make this again.

Mostly followed the recipe, but added shredded mozzarella between each layer. Rather than cooking in a slow cooker, I poured into a 9”x13” casserole dish, covered with foil, and baked at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. It’s a keeper!

This is so good, and so filling! I cut the recipe in half, as it is just my spouse and I, and we still have some left over. 

I didn't make any other changes.
We'll definitely make this again soon!

This was sort of a different variation of my normal lasagne. This was much easier to make and tasted delicious. My whole family absolutely loved it.... no leftovers on this one I will definitely make again for my daughter home from college in a few weeks

My family loved it, especially my brothers. I personally will most likely make some adjustments, but that's par for the course with recipes that include spaghetti sauce. I love cheese, and I think I'll be adding some in between the layers of raviolis, versus doing it without. All in all, it's an easy and tasty meal.
This was very easy to make and tastes very good. I will make this again.
Love this recipe. Easy and YUMMY!!! My kind of meal. I follow it as written. It's perfect, every time.
I made this last night, followed the recipe exactly and everyone loved it and went back for seconds. Will definitely be adding this into the regular rotation.
Was delicious. Added spinach for green and to sneak in veggies. Family loved. Will make again. Did bake it though bc worries about ravioli falling apart.
This was okay. I think next time I will leave out the cheese ravioli. I will make it again because overall the flavor was okay.

The only change I made was not adding basil and Italian seasoning. The sauces I chose were flavorful enough. I should have used the cooking times from the recipe but I was too impatient and did 2 1/2 hours cooking and then 30 minutes with the cheese. It was still wonderful though.
This recipe is amazing the way it is!! Love it

I added a little red pepper flakes because my family likes things spicy, but the general consensus was that it’s a little dry. Next time I will layer cheese with the meat sauce and ravioli. Maybe cottage cheese or ricotta.

I added a little red pepper flakes because my family likes things spicy, but the general consensus was that it’s a little dry. Next time I will layer cheese with the meat sauce and ravioli. Maybe cottage cheese or ricotta.
I added baby spinach and red pepper flakes while simmering the sauce
I call this my Lazy Lasagna!! It's wonderful, throw the sauce in, add cheese and beef raviolis in, simmer all day and then add mozzarella cheese on top and you can't taste the difference!!
This was super easy and very very delicious! I layered the cheese into the layers and it turned out perfect, it tastes just like lasagna. I will defineatley be making this again!

Used world best lasagna meat sauce from this site instead of jarred pasta sauce and meat from this recipe. Used about 36 oz ravioli and added mozzarella and Parmesan into the three layers of ravioli. My daughter loves it more then actual lasagna so guess what- will be making two crockpots next time and having lots to freeze for when I don’t have time to cook. I actually had to turn my setting to high since at two hours (several reviewers said it only needed 2 hours) on low (with the extra layers) mine was not done. I did throw extra fresh parsley in with the last layer of cheese for the last 30 minutes of cooking
so easy and good. I added the cheese at the table.

I've never reviewed any recipes on here before, but this one needs to be reviewed. I read through the recipe and decided that this sounded good. I had all of the ingredients so why not! First using Recipe Pro's scale down, I changed everything to serve 4 people. Next I cut the amount of hamburger down and added a proportionate amount of Italian Sausage. From there I followed the instructions and VOILA! turned out one the best meals I've mad yet!
Awesome, thank you! I doubled the meat and added a thawed box of frozen spinach and an onion. We will make again for sure!
My husband really enjoyed this recipe! The only thing that I will change is adding more pasta sauce to make it a little more rich.

Excellent!!! Even leftovers are great. 
Our 6 year old LOVED it.
Absolutely delicious! So much better than I thought it would be. Family loved it and asked me to keep the recipe...enough said! Thanks for sharing!!
